title: The Bayesian Way
text:
Bayes Theorum
\[Pr(\theta|D)=\frac{Pr(D|\theta) Pr(\theta)}{Pr(D)} \tag{1}\]
\[Pr(\theta|D)=\frac{Pr(D|\theta) Pr(\theta)}{\int Pr(D|\theta^*) Pr(\theta^*) d\theta^*} \tag{2}\]
where \(Pr(\theta|D)\) is the Posterior, \(Pr(D|\theta)\) is the Likelihood, \(Pr(\theta)\) is the Prior and \(Pr(D)\) or \(\int Pr(D|\theta^*) Pr(\theta^*) d\theta^*\) is the Marginal Likelihood or Evidence.

title: Introduction
text:
What is this site for?
This site walks through examples from 4 different textbooks:

BDA (3rd Edition)
Statistical Rethinking (2nd Edition)
Doing Bayesian Data Analysis (2nd Edition)
Data Analysis Using Regression and Multilevel/Hierarchical Models (1st Edition)



Why is it a bit of a mess?
In an attempt to create resources while brushing up on material, these pages will initially read like a series of Bayesian rants. In due course, as I become better at Quarto, Stan and general coherence, these pages could well end up as a teaching resource!


Bugs, Issues & Feedback
If you find any issues or would like to see the github repository for this site, click on the github logo by the search bar in the top right and follow the options.
